thread.section_title: Latest business and finance news from New Zealand and the world's key markets - Yahoo New Zealand Finance
thread.title: Super Retail profit down 25%

title: Super Retail profit down 25%
text:
Fri, Aug 21, 2015, 11:34 AM NZST - New Zealand Markets close in 5 hrs 26 mins Super Retail profit down 25% AAP – 44 minutes ago Print 
Super Retail Group has suffered a 25 per cent slide in its full year profit following costs linked to the restructure of some of its businesses and the closure of its FCO chain in New Zealand. 
The company, which owns the Supercheap Auto, Rebel Sport and BCF chains, made a net profit of $81.1 million for the year to June 30, down from $108.4 million a year ago. 
The result was weighed down by $12.8 million in costs linked to the restructure of the group's Ray's Outdoors and Workout World businesses and a $16.2 million loss from the closure of FCO Fishing Camping Outdoors. 
Total sales for the year were up 7.1 per cent to $2.24 billion and chief executive Peter Birtles said the group would look to lift its revenue for the year ahead through new store openings and like-for-like sales. @YahooNZBusiness on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Consensus on online GST limit: Hockey AAP 
There is consensus amongst state and federal treasurers to get rid of the $1000 GST threshold on online purchases …
